bullets.text: U.S. GDP grew 3.3% in Q2, above initial estimates, underscoring resilient demand despite policy uncertainty.
Fed Governor Waller backs a series of rate cuts over the next six months, reinforcing an easing bias.
White House targets Fed and CDC leadership; Fed Governor Lisa Cook sues over dismissal, raising central bank independence concerns.
CDC upheaval after Director Monarez fired; internal morale drops, and CVS pauses Covid vaccinations in 16 states amid policy uncertainty.
EU to remove tariffs on U.S. industrial goods, with reciprocal auto tariff cuts, easing transatlantic trade frictions.
Intel secures $5.7 billion in federal support, advancing U.S. semiconductor capacity under evolving industrial policy.
Nvidia’s top two unnamed customers accounted for 39% of Q2 revenue, highlighting concentration risk in AI demand.
AI hardware divergence: Pure Storage jumps 32% on Meta deal, while Dell and Marvell slide on softer outlooks versus AI hype.
Affirm turns profitable as consumers flock to 0% APR loans; shares surge on revenue and earnings beat.
Retail bifurcation: Gap misses and warns on tariffs, Nike trims staff; Ulta Beauty and Dick’s lift guidance on broad category growth.
Pending home sales fall and contract cancellations spike, signaling affordability and financing strains in housing.
AI adoption associated with a 13% jobs decline for young U.S. workers, reshaping entry-level labor markets.
Tesla’s European sales plunge 40% as BYD surges, highlighting intensifying EV competition and shifting consumer preferences.
Caltech achieves quantum memory lasting 30 times longer, a step toward more practical quantum networks and computers.
